data.title: Terminate task dialog doesn't terminate
data.body:
Testing #19057
- create a task in task.json
```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "yeoman",
            "command": "yo"
        } 
    ],
    "_runner": "terminal" 
}
```
- run the task
- while the task is running, run a second task
- dialog asks:
There is an active running task right now. Terminate it first before executing another task.
Also note that the output view is made visible.
- Click on 'Terminate Running Task'
- Second dialog shows up: 
The tasks are executed in the intergrated terminal. Use the terminal to manage the tasks.

Would be better to only show one dialog. Why restrict the tasks so that only one can run at a time? The terminal gives the possibility to manage them individually.

```json
{

        }

}
```
- Run the task
- the terminal opens and shows the yeoman generator.
- Try starting the generator UI. You first need to give focus to the terminal

data.title: Terminal should inherit fontFamily and fontSize from editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19071

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have the following settings
```
	"editor.fontFamily": "hack",
	"editor.fontSize": 13,
```

2. Open the terminal

The fontSize seems to be 14. The font is not fully clear to. Would be nice if the terminal inherits the settings from the editor.

data.title: No Launch Gear to create launch.json file when no workspace is open
data.body:
Testing #18397 on Windows

- Open a single js file in VS Code Insiders
- Open the Debug Side Pane

You can see the Play button to start running/debugging, but no gear button to configure launch.json
The gear is available if you open a workspace though.

data.title: Terminal cursor doesn't change when in override / insert mode
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19071

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start cmd.exe
2. toggle between insert and override mode (insert key)

Observe: the cursor stays the same however the functionality works as expected. Would be nice if the cursor would change like in cmd.exe

data.title: insertCursorAtEndOfEachLineSelected: Should not add cursor to last line if that line's selection is empty

1. Select, e.g., two complete lines (including the newline, i.e., the caret is at the beginning of the third line)

4. Actual: Cursors at ends of lines 1, 2 and 3

data.title: Callback functions don't have the expected indentation
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

In TypeScript (maybe other languages too), callback functions don't have the expected indentation when placed on a new line. Such is the case when using the `subscribe` method on an `Observable` in [rxjs](https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs).

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. The following file was formatted using the keyboard shortcut. Notice how the `onNext` and `onError` callbacks line up with the `subscribe` method.
![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 12 07 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1054833/22262322/b6b4c180-e22d-11e6-99fc-0945be261180.png)

2. I would rather see those two callbacks indented one more level like so:
![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 12 09 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1054833/22262386/ea693128-e22d-11e6-980b-bd522fbe02a8.png)

data.title: VS Code cannot load extension with prerelease version if earlier, non-prerelease version is installed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: VS Code Stable 1.8.1 and VS Code Insiders 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the PowerShell extension from the Marketplace
2. Install this VSIX using `code --install-extension filename.vsix`: https://ci.appveyor.com/api/buildjobs/kqjgav8i2q1nowlq/artifacts/PowerShell-0.9.1-insiders-17.vsix
3. Start VS Code and open the Extensions pane
4. Observe that the new extension is recognized but it always shows the "Reload" button:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/22262038/2943c052-e224-11e6-8694-814747e5f07c.png)

You can also see that this message is in the dev console:

```
Overwriting extension C:/Users/daviwil/.vscode-insiders/extensions/ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.9.1-insiders-16 with C:/Users/daviwil/.vscode-insiders/extensions/ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.9.0.
```

If you uninstall both extensions and then *only* install the "insiders" extension, everything works fine.  Maybe the version comparison code for prerelease extensions isn't respecting the greater patch version digit?

data.title: "emmet.syntaxProfiles" setting does not overwrite all in syntaxProfiles.json

I cannot verify that, I still get self-closing tags, also after reloading the workbench.

data.title: Changes to Emmet config files not picked up without reload

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure "emmet.extensionsPath" with the three config files
2. Notice that the path is picked up without reload, but changes to any of the three config files require a reload.
(E.g., switch between xhtml and html, between pt and px, change a snippet.)

data.title: Saving .vscode/task.json should always refresh task list
data.body:
Testing #19057

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:29:13.076Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|1.4.3|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.1|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|

---

I have the following file saved, no errors show up but the task list still shows the old values, even when I close and open the file.

```js
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "npm",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "_runner": "terminal",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "install",
            "args": ["install"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "lint",
            "args": ["run", "tslint"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "test",
            "args": ["run", "test"]
        },
        {
          "taskName": "watch",
          "args": ["run", "dev"],
          "isBuildCommand": true
        }
    ]
}
```

After creating this issue the list refreshed (window focus?)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Interactive Playground - keybinding design isn't great
data.body:
This may simply be my opinion, but I find the styling for the keybindings tough on the Interactive Playground. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/22260685/f37f878a-e21e-11e6-895a-8ec7a35b4ae1.png)

Some ideas to improve
- Instead of showing `shift+ctrl+up`, `shift+ctrl+down`, `shift+ctrl+left`, and `shift+ctrl+right` change to `shift+ctrl+<arrow key>` (I don't love this approach, but something to keep it tighter)
- style similar to what Github does for `kbd` tags (e.g. <kbd>shift+ctrl+left</kbd>

data.title: User Snippets not showing up in quickSuggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.2.2|
|asp|ilich8086|0.0.1|
|htmltagwrap|bradgashler|0.0.3|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.0.33|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|vs-code-xml-format|fabianlauer|0.1.4|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|classic-asp|ilich8086|0.0.2|
|vscode-todo|MattiasPernhult|0.8.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.1.2|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|

---

Is anyone else having issues with user defined Snippets?  
I am coding in basic HTML and I have the below HTML Snippets defined:
```
"Tech Option": {
        "prefix": "techoption",
        "body": [
            "<%=strTechOut%>"
        ],
        "description": "Tech Option"
    },
    "Tech All": {
        "prefix": "techall",
        "body": [
            "<option value=\"%\">All</option>",
            "<%=strTechOut%>"
        ],
        "description": "Tech All"
    },
    "Center": {
        "prefix": "centerthis",
        "body": [
            "<Center>",
            "   ${Data}",
            "</Center>"
        ],
        "description": "Places a center tag with caller to enter data in code"
    },
    "myOption": {
        "prefix": "myoption",
        "body": [
            "<option value=${Value}>${Text}</option>"
        ],
        "description": "Places an option tag with callers to enter data in code"
    },
    "mySelect": {
        "prefix": "mySelect",
        "body": [
            "<select id=${id} name=${name} size=\"1\">",
            "   <option value=${Value}>${Text}</option>",
            "</select>"
        ],
        "description": "Places a select tag with option block including callers in code"
    },
    "myNoWrap": {
        "prefix": "myNoWrap",
        "body": [
            " "
        ],
        "description": "Places a no wrap tag in code"
    },
    "Validation": {
        "prefix": "Validation",
        "body": [
            "validation=${Validation}"
        ],
        "description": "Enters a validation script into code."
    },
    "MyInput": {
        "prefix": "MyInput",
        "body": [
            "<input type=${Type} name=${Name} id=${Name} value=${Value}>"
        ],
        "description": "Enters a full input tag into code."
    },
    "MyDocument":{
        "prefix": "MyDocument",
        "body": [
            "document.getElementById(${ID})"
        ],
        "description": "Enters document java tag into code"
    }
```
When I type MySel or MyIn, the autoCompletions used to show my defined Snippets and allow me to select it.  Now, my Snippets aren't even showing up. I would attach an image to this but I also just noticed that when VSCode has the focus of my mouse, my PrintScreen button doesn't work so I can't capture the auto suggestions that are appearing in the list.

data.title: Terminating terminal task moves focus to output panel (and doesn't terminate)
data.body: Testing #19057 - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:29:13.076Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4| |lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0| |sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0| |theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10| |vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.0| |gitlens|eamodio|1.4.3| |git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.1| |md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1| |vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0| |seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3| --- Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19241 Running a task in the terminal and trying to relaunch it will send focus to output and give this message: I expect the message box to appear without focus change to the output panel since I have `_runner` set to terminal. It also doesn't appear to terminate the watch task. I was using the build task in the following file on [xterm.js](https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js): ```js { // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558 // for the documentation about the tasks.json format "version": "0.1.0", "command": "npm", "isShellCommand": true, "showOutput": "always", "suppressTaskName": true, "_runner": "terminal", "tasks": [ { "taskName": "install", "args": ["install"] }, { "taskName": "update", "args": ["update"] }, { "taskName": "test", "args": ["run", "test"] }, { "taskName": "watch", "args": ["run", "dev"], "isBuildCommand": true } ] } ```

data.title: Tree rendering cheese

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I was scrolling up in the explorer and it gave me the following: After seeing this, I scrolled down to the bottom and back up and everything was fine: Info on state: - I had the following repo/commit open: https://github.com/Tyriar/xterm.js/tree/dd761bcc9dca967e6d5d190e312887bc36ce02b4 - Deps and build was done (`npm i && npm run build`) - `lib` and `src` directories were expanded - No errors in console I believe I've seen this before about a week ago but it fixed itself like this and couldn't repro again.

Testing #19057

- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|

|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup and run a watch task that doesn't terminate
2. Add `"_runner": "terminal"` to `tasks.json`
3. Try run the task again
4. You will be asked to terminate, it doesn't appear to do it, repeat 3-4

2. Type: foo`<space>`f

data.title: Backspace triggering completion proposals can be confusing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:29:13.076Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: None

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open empty html file
2. Type: foo`<space>`f`<enter>`
3. Completes to: foo`<space>`foo`<caret>`
4. Assume `<enter>` was meant to start a new line
5. Therefore type: `<backspace><backspace><enter>`
6. Expected: foo`<space>`f`<newline><caret>`
7. Actual (again): foo`<space>`foo`<caret>`
